did.unittitle: William Wagner business papers and miscellaneous records of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Emma Garman (d. 1943) was a science teacher at Wagner Junior HIgh School in Philadelphia. She received her M.A. from the University of Pennsylvania, and her Ph.D. from Temple University.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of numerous letters and documents pulled from various files by Emma Garman for her 1941 dissertation on the history of the Wagner Free Institute of Science. The letters have been arranged as Garman organized them. Many of the letters deal with Wagner's commercial affairs, and seem to be typical examples of his business correspondence. The collection also includes materials relating to William Wagner's beginnings with Stephen Girard, as well as a few records of the Institute. There are a handful of letters dating from 1918 to 1921 from the Philadelphia Mineralogical Society and the City History Society of Philadelphia to John Rothermel, the Director of the Wagner from 1903-1924.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
